info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 9:27PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS POSSIBLE FROM HEAT BURSTS OVER BUFFALO AND KEARNEY COUNTIES... At 917 PM, strong winds and a rapid but brief warming spike in temperatures occurred near Kearney in Buffalo County. This rare weather phenomenon called a heat burst will remain possible over parts of both Buffalo and Kearney Counties through 1030 PM. Heat bursts are caused by decaying thunderstorms and only develop in an extremely unique environment. The rare setup for a heat burst is dry air directly beneath a weakening elevated thunderstorm. When a thunderstorm is weakening, air within the thunderstorms begins to sink. If this sinking air is very dry and high enough, it will begin to accelerate toward the ground since it is more dense. Any remaining precipitation will fall through this dry air and quickly evaporate. As the air continues downward, it warms rapidly due to compression.
